skill.name: ghe-requirements
skill.description: This skill should be used when creating, updating, linking, or versioning requirements for GitHub Elements threads. Use when user mentions requirements, specs, REQ files, or when starting feature development. Provides the requirements folder structure, versioning system, and SERENA backup protocols.
skill.summary: Manages versioned requirements files for GitHub Elements workflows with automated linking and backup
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown examples of shell commands for requirements management. All detected patterns (external_commands, filesystem access, version strings) are false positives - the file contains documentation with example bash scripts in code blocks, not executable code. No malicious patterns, command injection vectors, or dangerous operations found.

content.user_title: Manage Feature Requirements in GitHub Issues
content.value_statement: Managing feature requirements without a structured system leads to scope creep and misaligned implementations. This skill provides versioned markdown requirements files with automated GitHub issue linking and SERENA memory backup for persistent, traceable development workflows.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured requirements files in markdown format with version tracking
Implements semantic versioning for requirements with automated version bumps
Links requirements documents to GitHub issues for traceability
Backs up requirements to SERENA memory bank for persistent storage
Validates that issues have linked requirements before development begins
Tracks acceptance criteria and atomic changes for each requirement
limitations: Requires GitHub integration to function - cannot operate with other issue tracking systems
Does not create files directly - generates content for user review before writing
Cannot approve requirements autonomously - human approval required for status changes

use_cases.title: Start New Feature Development
use_cases.description: Create a requirements document before beginning any feature work. Define user stories, acceptance criteria, and atomic changes. Link the REQ file to a new GitHub issue to ensure clear scope boundaries.
use_cases.target_user: Developers starting new features who need clear requirements

use_cases.title: Track Requirement Changes
use_cases.description: Update requirements with version bumps when acceptance criteria change. Automatically notify linked issues when versions update. Maintain revision history for audit trails.
use_cases.target_user: Technical project managers tracking evolving scope

use_cases.title: Validate Development Progress
use_cases.description: Verify that test and review phases meet all acceptance criteria from requirements. Check that implementation matches technical requirements and atomic changes are complete.
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers and reviewers validating implementations

prompt_templates.title: Link Requirements to New Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new feature requirement document for [feature name]. The requirement should include: 1) User story, 2) 3-5 acceptance criteria, 3) Technical requirements, 4) Atomic changes breakdown. Then create a GitHub issue in the [EPIC]-[DEV] format with the requirements linked.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting new feature development with proper requirements documentation

prompt_templates.title: Version and Update Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: The requirement REQ-[XXX] needs to be updated to include [new criteria]. Bump the version appropriately (minor for added criteria), update the status, and notify all linked issues about the changes.
prompt_templates.scenario: Updating requirements due to scope changes or newly identified needs

prompt_templates.title: Create SERENA Backup
prompt_templates.prompt: Back up all active requirements to the SERENA memory bank. Ensure the backup excludes templates and changelog files. Verify the backup completed successfully.
prompt_templates.scenario: Preparing for context compaction or ensuring persistent storage

prompt_templates.title: Validate Requirements Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Check issue #[NUMBER] for compliance with its linked requirements. Verify: 1) Requirements file exists and is accessible, 2) All acceptance criteria have corresponding tests passing, 3) Implementation covers all atomic changes.
prompt_templates.scenario: Validating that implementation matches documented requirements

output_examples.input: Create requirements for a new user authentication feature
output: - [ ] Users can register with email and password
- CHANGE-1: Create user model and database schema

output_examples.input: Update REQ-003 to version 1.1.0 and notify linked issues
output: Updated REQ-003 from v1.0.0 to v1.1.0
Changes: Added AC-4 for error handling requirements

best_practices: Always create requirements before starting development to establish clear scope boundaries
Link every DEV phase issue to its requirements document for traceability
Update requirements with version bumps and notify linked issues when scope changes
anti_patterns: Skipping formal requirements documentation leads to scope creep and misaligned implementations
Modifying specifications without user approval violates the iron law of user specifications
Starting development without linking requirements causes traceability gaps in the project

faq.question: When should I create a requirements file?
faq.answer: Create a requirements file at the start of any feature development. Requirements must be linked to GitHub issues before the DEV phase begins. This ensures clear scope definition and traceability.

faq.question: How do I version requirements properly?
faq.answer: Use semantic versioning: PATCH for typos and clarifications, MINOR for added criteria or atomic changes, MAJOR for breaking changes to acceptance criteria. Always update the version field and revision history.

faq.question: What happens when requirements change?
faq.answer: Bump the version, update the status, and notify all linked issues. Each linked issue must review the changes and potentially adjust implementation. The update must be committed to version control.

faq.question: Can I skip requirements for small changes?
faq.answer: No. Even small changes require requirements documentation. The require_agents setting in ghe.local.md can block DEV phase claims without linked requirements. Formal documentation prevents scope creep.

faq.question: How does SERENA backup work with requirements?
faq.answer: The skill copies requirements files to .serena/memories/requirements/ for persistent storage. SERENA backup should occur after creation, updates, and before context compaction. This ensures requirements survive context exhaustion.

faq.question: Who approves requirements?
faq.answer: Humans must approve requirements. The skill can change status from draft to approved after you review and validate the content. Automated agents cannot approve requirements - this requires human judgment.
